After Judwaa 2, Daddy David Dhawan Is All Set To Cast Varun Dhawan In The Remake Of 'Coolie No 1'
After Judwaa 2, Daddy David Dhawan Is All Set To Cast Varun Dhawan In The Remake Of 'Coolie No 1'
After the grand success of Judwaa 2, Daddy David Dhawan is all set to direct the remake of his 1995 classic Coolie No.1. It doesn't come as a surprise that the filmmaker has roped in his son Varun Dhawan to reprise the role that was originally played by Govinda.
The news was confirmed by Varun Dhawan himself as he spoke to BBC. He added that the remake would be directed by his father, veteran Director David Dhawan, who had directed the original film. The film also starred Karisma Kapoor.
When he was quizzed if Alia would be seen reprising Karisma Kapoor's role, Varun Dhawan refuted the rumour. He added,
“I can’t do every film with Alia Bhatt...That you will know soon, I don’t want to say it now but Alia and me are not working. We’ll do something..after...we’ll give a little break to people because I think for everyone it is like ‘oh, they are back again’.”
On the professional front, Varun Dhawan has had a great first innings in the film industry. After making his debut with Student of the Year, the actor has a success rate of 100% with impressive films like Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania, Badlapur and Badrinath Ki Dulhania.
